intro: Nanorrhinum kuriense, commonly known as the Kuriense horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes罂粟 (opium poppies) and other similar species. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, horn-shaped petals that give it its common name. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Nanorrhinum kuriense is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
